triageFlags.title: Missing Credit Report Data
triageFlags.description: The credit report is not available for this proposal.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to the lack of sufficient data for credit assessment.
triageFlags.reasoning: Credit history and credit score are critical factors in risk assessment. Without them, it is impossible to assess the applicant's financial health or determine compliance with credit score-related policy requirements.

triageFlags.title: Credit Tier Mismatch
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in Tier C, but they do not meet the minimum score required for Tier B.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reviewing additional compensating factors or requesting more deposit.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 2.1 requires a credit score of at least 620 for Tier B. The applicant's score is 600, which places him in the Tier C risk category (score range 550-619). This triggers stricter lending criteria as per policy.

triageFlags.title: LTV Ratio Exceeds Tier C Limit
triageFlags.description: The loan-to-value (LTV) ratio for this deal is within the maximum limit of Tier C.
triageFlags.recommendation: Proceed with caution, ensuring other Tier C criteria are satisfied, or consider mitigating measures such as additional deposit.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 4.1 states that applicants categorized as Tier C are subject to a maximum LTV of 95%. The calculated LTV ratio is 67.97%, which is adequately below the maximum permissible limit.

triageFlags.title: DTI Ratio Well Below Limit for Tier C
triageFlags.description: The applicant’s DTI ratio is significantly below the maximum threshold for Tier C.
triageFlags.recommendation: No action required; this demonstrates strong affordability.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 3.1 states that the DTI max threshold for Tier C applicants is 35%. With a DTI ratio of 2%, the applicant far exceeds affordability requirements, indicating low risk in terms of their ability to make monthly payments.

triageFlags.title: Vehicle Age at End of Term Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The vehicle’s age at the end of the agreement term exceeds the allowable maximum by one year.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider declining the finance or reducing the loan term to align with policy requirements.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 4.2 states that a vehicle’s age at the end of the agreement must not exceed 12 years. The proposed agreement’s 60-month term results in the vehicle being 13 years old at the end of the term, which is a policy violation.
